description: This is a small cozy place. The service was really nice. The menu had a nice variety of options. I love green curry, so I had to get that with shrimp.  It was spicy, not burning lips spicey, with a hint of sweetness. I had hot tea since it was a chilly evening. The tea had a wonderful maltiness to it, very subtle. My only regret was not getting to sample more of menu!
author: DeAnna S.

description:
Green curry has a nice kick even for those who think they can't handle spicy foods. Just add a bit to our coconut rice (!) and you're set. I got it was chicken. Overall I though my green curry was a bit watered down. 

The fried calamari is a decent portion for the price you pay. It is in the ring form. 

Pad Sew Ew with beef was alright. I feel like I've had better. The beef texture was like beef jerky.
author: Jess W.

description:
BA-DA BUM BUM BUM. I'm loving it. Thai Cottage Restaurant had a modern feel to it. The cuisine, however, was seemingly true to its culture. The spices, the flavor, the coconut were all present and vibrant through every dish. 

We ordered the: 
-Tom Yum Soup
-Pad Thai
-Pumpkin Curry 
-Chicken Skewers 
-Penang Curry (I believe)  

The only complaint I have is of the wait-staff. We noticed one of the plates and silverware, they distributed, was dirty and upon bringing it up to her she hesitated to take it back. She seemed a bit on edge throughout the duration of our meal, but I can't complain much because she got the job done.
author: Angelica P.

description: I LOOOVE Thai food and Thai Cottage has amazing authentic Thai food with those traditional flavors we all love! I recently went to the restaurant while in SF after hanging out in Golden Gate Park with some old friends/family and I couldn't of had a better meal. The food was incredibly delicious, wonderfully fresh and left you wanting more even after being full. I was able to try many dishes as we were a large group that they accommodated - the yellow curry with beef and white rice, larb -tofu and chicken, a coconut soup (can't remember the name but it was unreal!!! Loooved!), crispy tofu, cucumber salad, even their peanut dipping sauce was unbelievable! It was one of those meals you want again right away and can't stop thinking about. Hands down the best authentic Thai food I've ever had! I can't wait to go back, Thank you Sabrina and Zero!!!
author: Elyse J.

description: 5 Stars for the food quality and tastiness. We were in the neighborhood seeking a place to eat and wanted to avoid long lines. We fell upon this cozy and quaint establishment and ordered the PadSeEw, Duck Curry and Fried Egg Rice as main dishes and the dessert of course was the sticky Mango coconut rice. All were authentically tasty and full of flavor. Here is a pic of our finished dishes cause it was all so yummy!!!
author: Theresa N.

description: Oh yes! We tried several dishes...all excellent...all fresh...light...delicious! I am giving this place a 5 on a to go...and they goofed one small thing in our order. First...the gal on the phone taking the order and greeting me with my order was super nice. Although parking is a bear, my son dropped me off...so I could just run in. The establishment is small, but clean with a nice ambiance. We ordered: spicy eggplant and tofu; thai cottage rice; fried catfish; pad seeyu noodles and eggrolls. I ordered spring rolls...but they gave us fried egg rolls instead. Amazing! Will be back.
author: Laura P.

description:
We live across the park from Thai Cottage and are lucky we do! It's on our list of three favorite SF Thai restaurants and gets the nod most times the craving hits not just for its location but for the quality of the food and the absolutely lovely staff. We usually get take out but when we do eat in we are always treated with friendly smiles in a relaxed environment. It's a tiny little place but is packed with warmth. We've eaten up and down the menu and are never, ever, disappointed with our choices. Whether it be noodles, curries, or soups, the result is always delicious and satisfying. Never greasy or heavy and that's always nice! 
So thanks, sweet Thai Cottage, for feeding us so often and so well!!
author: Rob W.

description:
DELISH. Came here on a Saturday evening for two and had a 15-20 min wait (I think there was a large party or two already seated). The place is pretty small and quaint, so you might be rubbing elbows with the tables next to you. 

Let's get down to it: the food was amazing. My taste buds were delighted. We ordered the papaya salad (tasty, but spicier than you'd probably imagine), Tom kha soup, and pumpkin curry. I'd order each plate again! Thanks!
author: Deborah D.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant! The food is fresh with just the right spice. Love Rain!
author: Jeanine L.

description: The noodles in the pad Thai were mushy and I found an egg shell in it as well. This was not a small egg shell. Sign of laziness and carelessness if you ask me.
author: Harrison K.

description:
Pretty good Thai place in the outer sunset!!! Small restaurant with about 7 - 10 tables. 

Service was pleasant and quick!! 

I tried the garlic noodles and BBQ chicken! Pretty good, wished it had more chicken though

Looking forward to trying the other dishes they offer
author: Daniel S.

description:
Was walking around looking for a spot to grab a quick bite and decided try Thai Cottage.   

Quaint but clean interior design vibe with a pretty mural adorning one of the walls.  

Service was prompt and friendly.  Only glitch was their credit card machine was not working so glad I happened to have some cash on me.  

Food was tasty, fresh , and well presented.  Recommend if youre in the area.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
I won't tip tonight because of the terrible service I received.
I came here at 7:55PM, immediately after I entered I ordered a pad Thai with shrimp. Then I just sat there, waiting 25mins for my order. 25mins is far beyond a reasonable time for cooking a single dish of pad Thai.
I'm a Chinese woman by myself, all the white costumers who came after me were served before me. I suspect there's a discrimination here.
The server here also seemed to have a sloppy attitude. She even "slammed" the water bottle on my table.
author: Nannan L.

description:
Got take out from this place yesterday. Here's what I ordered:

Chicken w/ Peanut Sauce (came with rice)
Pad see Yew
Crispy Spring Twin Rolls
1 side of rice

The service was fast, I believe my food was ready for pickup in 10 minutes or so. The total order came out to $30.00. A bit pricey in my book, especially since the portion sizes arent tremendously huge.

The food itself wasn't very good. The pad see yew had a strange after-taste and the Chicken with peanut sauce was just OK at best. The Crispy Twin Rolls were pretty good though.
author: James D.

description: Excellent food, and a really nice atmosphere. The chicken Satay was plumper and tastier than even other very good Thai restaurants.
author: M W.

description: Great Thai food in a cozy and very friendly setting. Try their pineapple fried rice - it has some great flavors. Also love their fried tofu appetizer. It's soft and silky - just perfect. Parking is an issue. Just park a couple of blocks away and take a quick walk. Overall a great Thai food restaurant that's also rather inexpensive.
author: Jonas G.

description: Good authentic Thai food. Pad Thai, chicken satay, and Thai ice tea all our favorites. Slow on the "to-go" orders, but very apologetic as they have a smaller kitchen.
author: Virginia C.

description:
Good Thai food, but service can be pretty slow here.

The Larb and Papaya Salad is extremely spicy, so beware.  I've enjoyed the Thai Fried Rice and the Garlic Noodles with BBQ Chicken here.  Great flavors and done very well.  I've also had the Cottage Fried Rice, which, from the description seems to be a better version of the Thai Fried Rice.  However, the flavor wasn't as great.

Prices were good here.  It's actually cheaper than the other Thai place I've been getting takeout from.  But the slow service also pertains to takeout as well.
author: Karen L.

description: This restaurant is small and inviting. The lady serving us is kind; she accommodated my request for crunchy tofu in my Pad Thai. I appreciate that. The flavors blend well together, and the portions are perfect. A delightful dinner experience.
author: Zena B.

description: Chicken Gra Prow Grob was delicious!! Found the restaurant on Yelp after seeing the score of 98/100.
author: Patricia H.

description:
Ordered for take-out because bf lived nearby and we just wanted to eat at home. Phoned in and placed our order. Person said it would take 30-35 minutes for it to be ready. Arrived to pick-up after 35 minutes as mentioned. Small restaurant with an intimate feel and cute interior! It wasn't really busy, for a Saturday night. Made me wonder why our order took so long? A person in front of me ordered for to-go and they said his food would take about 15 minutes. 

Had ordered chicken satay, pad thai, and beef red curry with rice.

Everything was packaged quite nice. Food was okay at best. Pad thai was on the drier side and was clumpy. I think our food was ready a lot sooner than the 30 minute time given. I've had pad thai that I to-go'd and left out and later ate better than this.

Chicken Satay was super dry and tough.. Was nice that they packed a small sauce container of cucumber salad to go with it though.

Beef red curry with rice was the best of the three. Tasted just like I expected and was a big save from the other two items.
author: Tina N.

description:
Maybe we walked in too close to closing time, but just had the worst Pad Thai ever(we got take out).  Superrrrrrrrrr dry, very little chicken(maybe 4 pieces), tastes likes 1-week old fridge spaghetti.  

We have been here several time before and it had been pretty tasty, and the staff is always really nice.  I hate to rate this place so low, but this pad thai was terrible if not inedible, probably not coming back.
author: David D.

description: The Pad Thai is the best in town! The spring rolls were a great start to our meal. The service was prompt and responsive. Definitely will be back!
author: Becky J.

description:
Wife and I visited her cousin and this is the local Thai restaurant. Very good Thai food. Wife had her beloved green curry which she loves. I had the pad Thai and it was right up there with the best versions I have had outside of Bangkok.

If you are looking for good Thai food you can do way worse than this place. Parking can be tough but worth it.
author: Bill H.

description:
I love it at Thai Cottage! After living in Thailand for some time I was missing the thai taste! Their fried rice with chicken is a great standard. And their Panang Curry was amazing. I've been several times and always the best! Khun Ploy is also very nice and welcoming everytime I there. 

I'll be back soon!!
author: Jenedine E.

description: Love this place. I always get the duck fried rice. So good. I go in there so much that one time I left my wallet at home and they told me just to pay them the next time I come in.
author: Josh C.

description:
Excellent neighborhood Thai spot! 

This place is rather tiny (seats under 20) so call in before you come. The guy waiting the tables was incredibly friendly and answered my go to question of "what would you get?". 

We tried:
- tom kha: I get it every time I get Thai. This one was unique. It was very milky with a lot of coconut milk and very low spice level. Very delicious!
- garlic noodles with BBQ chicken: This seemed to be very popular on their Yelp page. We loved the noodles because they were thin and didn't have an overbearing taste of garlic.
- green curry: very refreshing and slightly spicy. 

Thai cottage is nothing fancy or mind blowing, but it has great tasting Thai food. Overall, I think I found my new go to Thai place.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Brought my parents here for dinner and got the Papaya salad, duck cottage, pad see ew with beef, and spicy green curry with Chicken.  Very small place with reasonable pricing especially in the city.  They however do not have pork so you can choose from chicken, prawns, and beef.  

They put a lot of meat in the dishes except the duck cottage so that was definitely a + for me.  My favorite was the green curry with chicken.  There were a lot of complex flavors and the coconut milk (I think?) mixed with the spiciness was so delicious!  The pad see ew was my least favorite and wish they gave a bit more flat noodles.  I believe there was 5 pieces of duck and it was quite good as well, but it came on a bed of raw cabbage with sauce.  The papaya salad was also very good, but my mom thought it was a bit too sour so she couldn't eat much of it.  

I would come back again!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
This is my favorite Thai place in the city. I've brought so many friends here that I've lost count and they all loved it. Small, cozy space with super friendly staff. Food is always consistent over the three or four years I've been coming here. Pad Thai is on point, eggplant tofu is sweet and spicy, and the Penang Beef is yum with brown rice. Wine selections are good too. I've been here twice this week and I'm headed back again on Saturday with my family. 

Easy to get a table on weekdays, but call ahead to reserve on weekends.
author: Virg Y.

description: Garlic noodle with BBQ chicken was delicious! The pineapple fried was good too with a pretty big portion size. Pad Thai was mediocre. I've had better pad Thai before. The interior was decent.
author: Timothy S.

description: Great food; decent prices. My family loves this quiet spot for an early dinner. Will most certainly be back. Advise reservations for later in the evening on weekends.
author: Suzette C.

description:
Here is a neighborhood thai food restaurant that we love to come. Not only the food tastes good but the staff is helpful and welcoming.

Celebrating mom's birthday, we ordered a few dishes which everything was perfect especially salmon yang or bbq salmon. Absolutely legit!!
author: Pat R.

description:
My wife called in to order pad thai with beef and was told the total was $10.95 after tax.  

1. When I went to pick up I was told $11.91 and 10.95 was before tax.

2. When I handed the cash the guy had the nerve to ask "do you want change?" which is equivalent to asking for a tip (and for a to-go order).

3. After realizing I gave him $22, he gave me back $10.  So essentially I paid $12.  Nice that he rounded up in their favor, but I didn't feel like arguing over a few cents.

4. When I got home, I checked menu on yelp and the price showed $8.99 (which my wife also saw before she ordered).  But I don't know if that's an error by Yelp.

5. The menu also shows it comes with shrimp, but we had no shrimp in our pad thai.  When my wife called to order they just told her to pick a meat.  Maybe the beef was a substitute, but why would they charge $2 MORE for beef (usually other way around).

Anyways, the food was just meh.  I could get similar quality for much cheaper elsewhere.
author: Nelson W.

description:
Tom Yum with Shrimp- on point , love the mushrooms, this touch adds to it

Tiger Salad - Char was perfect, spices on point, so delicious!

Thai Cottage Fried Rice - Favorite Thai fried rice in SF so far

Green Curry - Was good, I prefer two other places in SF for this , but this will do for sure

Overall- 4.5....since I can't I would round up not down - 5

* Update

So I ordered this to go-

I was really hungry, ate quite a bit, and broke to write the review....went back to eat more, and I must say, DELICIOUS, not even hungry just enticed, and I am satisfied with my 5 stars (4.5 to be exact and I think that rings as true as it gets)
author: David N.

description:
Pretty good.
Small clean place. 
Good food. Nothing too special but nothing to complain about. So if you're in San Francisco for just a fees days I wouldn't recco mend this place. Our waitress was super hard working as she had the entire restaurant after bay to breakers.
Try not to go to the bathroom here if possible.
author: Ashley G.

description: This is me and my boyfriends favorite go to Thai restaurant when we don't want to leave the house. It's just around the corner and have great service. They could be a bit more timely but over all great service!
author: Justyce S.

description:
Consistently solid Thai food for a very reasonable price.

You really cant ask for anything more than what you're getting at this cozy little spot near Ocean Beach. I'm a Thai food addict. You can find me in a Thai restaurant at least once a week. That's probably how I ended up in this place, right? Yes! I was past due to try a new spot, and so glad this was the one. Plus, I love giving exposure to spots in my neighborhood, as it's not one where many people actually make an effort to drive here for unless it's worth it.

The food here is cooked to perfection, the vibe (especially for a tiny little Thai place) was welcoming, the service was quick/efficient/friendly (think of basically any synonym to these words and they fit the bill). Now, on to the food itself- and trust me, there was a lot of it. For the appetizer I ordered the "Spicy Eggplant Tofu" (sauteed eggplant,tofu, bell pepper, onion, fresh chili and basil in garlic soy bean sauce). This thing is mouth watering! It's an entree dish, but I highly recommend it as an appetizer (though you really can't go wrong with the Satay Chicken. The peanut sauce is fantastic). For the entree I ordered the Red Curry (chicken with green bean, zucchini, bell pepper, bamboo shoot and basil). Man! What makes this place so great is how much food they give compared to their price. I would consider this spot one of the cheaper options, yet the food is easily comparable to more high end Thai restaurants. Sorry for the side note, the Red Curry is such a solid option. The third dish was the Pad See Ew (stir fried flat rice noodles with garlic, egg, carrot and broccoli) and usually I have that with my Red Curry (it's such a perfect blend of perfection!). 

Final verdict: Outer Sunset is a district where you really have to make an effort to explore before finding that hidden gem. There's little foot traffic, and it's up to us to help with the exposure of small little spots on Yelp. This place nails a trifecta in terms of food, service and ambiance. The prices are just as good. In a way, you can call it a grand slam.
author: Alex B.

description: I would love to give this place a 4 or more for food but the service is so terribly slow I had to dock points. If you are more patient than I am, definitely check this place out! The pumpkin curry was delicious and so was the pra-ram.
author: Lisa V.

description: Ordered the grilled beef salad. Soooo salty, couldn't finish it. Beef is over cooked and tough as cardboard, then coated in some kind of Panko or breading- texture is gritty and tough. Would not order or recommend this particular salad.
author: Jason L.

description:
Our experience at Thai Cottage last night was fantastic! The food, service, and ambience was all better than what I would have expected given that it was my first time there. I think it's hard to pinpoint what people mean in reviews when they say things taste "good, great, or even excellent" but when I sat down for dinner at 7:30pm last night, I wasn't even a bit hungry. Let's just say that when the food came, I was able to eat more than 1 serving of everything, PLUS dessert! ^___^ Yes, I had that much faith in the restaurant that I wanted to order dessert. We barely had any leftovers, and I willingly ate that for lunch today as well. 

I highly recommend the pad see ew (even though it's on the sweet side), the garlic noodle barbecue chicken (the chicken was barbecued to perfection, and the noodles weren't so garlicky as to make you suffer from garlic breath afterwards), and the pineapple fried rice. I asked them for a sticky rice with coconut ice cream dessert and that was amazing as well! ...okay, I'm guilty, I'd actually recommend everything. I loved their tom yum soup as well! Everything was the perfect amount of savory, sweet, or sour (whatever flavor the dish needed), and very appetizing!

The price was great for the quality and the portions of food that the restaurant serves. I would definitely return and I would consider Thai Cottage my go-to hole in the wall Thai restaurant.
author: Denise L.

description: Crazy delicious food and great service. Only downside is it is very small and so it can get crowded quickly. Try to call first to see if there is a table. If not the Mexican place next-door is also very good. The service is great. Nothing special with regard to the atmosphere and pretty basic. But the food and price knock the ball out of the park. My kids wanted to come back here the next night and apparently make it their regular food plan. I would go back in a heartbeat if I lived in that neighborhood. Enjoy!
author: Greg G.

description: Great food and prices, small simple space with no frills decor, speedy food to table after ordering.  We enjoyed the Pumpkin and green curries and Spicy cashew chicken. Would definitely return for more.
author: Debi C.

description: Cute little cottage restaurant nothing fancy but I do love the gold leaves on the wall. Super friendly service and good food. I recommend the pineapple duck curry. However the tomatoes weren't all tht fresh anymore..  The owners have heart for the neighborhood wanderers, I can appreciate that.
author: Lara K.

description: If u want amazing authentic homestyle Thai food, come to thai cottage.... It hits the spot and is a local great place in the outter sunset.. There is never a wait and the food is always top shelf.. My waitress is great at her job and said her family makes everything.. Any normal person would be highly satisfied.... better than king of thai!!!!
author: Victoria A.

description:
This place is a local neighborhood gem in outer sunset.  I'd certainly eat here again if I was in the area. We had a few items for a light dinner. Thai iced tea - less tea and more cream than I like but otherwise ok. Grilled fish balls - very tasty and the fish was not lost in other fillings. Papaya salad - more tangy and spicy than sweet. In fact, not sweet at all like most Thai places. Spicy eggplant tofu - not drowning in sauce; very tasty and the bell peppers and vegetables not over cooked, still crisp; also use fermented white soybeans, not black ones and are more flavorful.

Overall the food was not overcooked like many Thai places, which gave it a freshness that's missing elsewhere. And the food was a solid medium spicy. We didn't have to ask for hot just to get to what I think should be a medium.
author: Veggie S.

description: Greaaat food and friendly service!  Tried so many thai restaurant around the town, this place have the most authentic mango&sticky rice(my favorite when I traveled Thai, had it everyday). The entrees are delicious too, I had duck soup, mom had pad Thai, tasty as well. Definitely coming back...
author: XT H.

description: Super clean - delicious food - great service - cool ambiance - overall a restaurant to return to often. Pad Thai w a choice of meats or tofu was great, pumpkin curry delicious w choice of meat or tofu and the coconut soup was magnificent. Nothing tasted greasy or old. No weird smells and did I say clean. Service was excellent.
author: Ann P.

description:
Omg such a tiny cozy friendly space! Waiter was easygoing and nice. He would tell us he would get to us, even when he was frantically pacing back and forth keeping up with all the hard work.
Food is soo tasty and wonderful presentation. I love that this is so hidden; it feels like a local neighborhood restaurant. 

Pas see ew, green curry, rice plates were good. Beer available.

love! 

Gets busy at dinner and there are only about 5-6 tables.
author: Veranna N.

description: Came here around 5:45 and we were the only people in here but I think they just opened at 5. We chose our seat and the waiter brought us a pitcher of water right away and was so nice and polite! My friend and I ordered the Thai Iced Tea in cute mason jars and they were soo good!! We ordered the mild yellow chicken curry, spicy catfish, and chicken cashew plate. All dishes were EXCELLENT! My only small complaint is that there was barely any chicken in my curry, but other then that everything was very good. For dessert, I ordered the mango and sticky rice. What I loved most is that the waiter was super honest with me and told me he had to check if the mango was ripe enough to serve it. This is the place to go for great Thai food!!
author: Shanice C.

description: Average Thai food! We ordered the Pra Ram Tofu and the Thai Fried Rice. The peanut curry made the tofu too soggy and the vegetables were not mixed with the curry, creating an awkward salad on the side. The Fried rice lacked significant flavor and was slightly overlooked. It was definitely a one time visit for me!
author: Sneha K.

description:
Pretty close to perfect. Food is a tad dry, but oh my so delicious. I ordered the tofu pad see gow which is supposedly their popular dish. It really was delicious, wish there was a bit more sauce for the rice - which is included. 

Husband said pad Thai was great. The cucumber salad is so adorable and totally yummy. Ask for jasmine rice!
author: Monique P.

description: Saturday evening takeout proved to be very tasty: Silver noodle salad, beef pumpkin curry, shrimp pad thai, and duck cottage!
author: Liz T.

description:
We only tried Thai Cottage for dinner because I didn't put my name down for Outerlands earlier & then we didn't want to wait any longer in the cold Sat 10/20/12 5:30pm.

Thai Cottage is a few doors down form Outerlands, & it was warm & not busy so we tried it.

FREE tap water was given to us, nice.

Bowl of Tom Kha Ga Soup was enough for 2 - creamy, salty, we got chicken which is the frozen/cooked type, some mushrooms, green onions, spices, etc.  Fine.

Pad See Ew - I picked chicken, should have gotten veggie/tofu.  Tasted fine, fat rice noodles enough for 2 to share, some broccoli spears, carrot slices, green beans, etc.

Spicy Green Curry with choice of meats/or veggie & tofu.  We got veggie/tofu which was fine, curry was spicy, tasty enough.

Extra steamed white rice - fine.

Charged it.  One unisex bathroom in the back.
author: Ann L.

description:
So Surprised when I found out this place was just a few blocks from me in my neighborhood.
SOO good and fresh. Wish they delivered on those super lazy days. But worth the walk or drive over.
author: Danielle D.

description: Cute little Thai restaurant in the outer sunset. Its super convenient for take out since they're so fast. The pad thai and tom yum soup were delicious. Really liked the beef salad too.
author: Sherry L.

description: Super yummy and great customer service! I tried  their delicately made red curry and it was consistent with all the previous times I've had it :) totally recommended !!!
author: Shreen G.

description:
I've always walked by this place but never really noticed it because the outside isn't exactly eye catching. But tonight I thought I'd be bold and give it a shot, and it was THE BEST DECISION EVER. Immediately we were greeted by the friendliest waiter who sat us right away. It's a small restaurant, but it's the ambiance is relaxing and the decor is beautiful. Who would have ever guessed all of this was hiding behind the tacky red awning and run down store front that appeared outside! 

I started off with a Thai iced tea. It came in the cutest mason jar glass. Super unique. There are quite a few options on the menu and our waiter could tell I was overwhelmed and stepped in to help without hesitation. He have us great suggestions and even helped us save some money!! We got the Panang Curry, our waiters suggestion, and it  was DELICIOUS. Not too spicy but just the right amount of zing! Mix it with a little fried rice and it's a match made in heaven. And when it does get a little to hot to handle, a sip of their mouth watering Thai ice tea makes everything better.  

Thank you for a great dinner, great service, and an overall great night. We will be back soon! :)
author: Kellene R.

description: Thai Cottage is my favorite Thai restaurant here in San Francisco. Not that I've been to a lot of Thai restaurants but this is the best one that I've been to. My husband and I have been going here even when we were still dating. The place is pretty small but I can say that the quality of the food is still excellent. I think that it underwent new ownership since we first ate here in 2010 but they just made everything better. It feels more intimate and relaxing than before. Everything is just so flavorful and they make really good Pad Thai and Panang Curry. Those are our "must-have" dishes when we go there but there are other dishes that are also good. Ahhh, thinking about it makes me want to go there right now. Anyway, one should definitely try Thai Cottage when they're around Judah St. :)
author: Jewel L.

description: Mediocre Thai food at best. Had curry which was unimpressive. Pad Thai was way too sweet.
author: Jr. M.

description:
I would start with the best part first, but how can one choose just ONE best thing?! 
Our party ordered:
Yellow curry
Pineapple fried rice
Pumpkin curry
Crispy spring rolls
Crispy chicken fried rice
Garlic noodle with BBq chicken 
Tom gha (I think that was it, not Tom Kha, but the other soup)
A curry peanut dish
Thai iced coffee
Thai iced tea 
And coconut ice cream with sticky rice.
Everything was AMAZING. I don't even like peanut curry stuff and I was in awe of this dish! The garlic noodles were to die for, they had a delicious roasted garlic flavor, and they paired perfectly with the bbq chicken. 
The perfect end to the meal was coconut ice cream with sticky rice. The rice was hot, the ice cream was cold and creamy and they paired perfectly together. I would live off of this place if I could. 
The waitstaff was amazing, attentive and friendly and the joint was clean. 
I will be singing their praises for years to come!
author: Michelle H.

description:
We moved to the area over the summer & this place has become our "go-to" Thai. It is quite simply delicious! 
It's a small restaurant & it can get busy but the staff are always polite, friendly & attentive. 
We come here for take-out too & have never had a bad meal. Highly recommended.
author: Fi M.

description:
Food is soo tasty and wonderful presentation. I love that this is so hidden; it feels like a local neighborhood restaurant. So Surprised when I found out this place was just a few blocks from me in my neighborhood.
SOO good and fresh. Wish they delivered on those super lazy days. But worth the walk or drive over.
author: Ahmad T.

description: Thai Cottage continues to impress. It's a must-go dinner stop when in outer sunset. The owners are wonderful and the food is delicious. Even take-out.
author: Char Z.

description: I ordered duck noodle soup. It was pretty good. I use to eat a bit for dinner. But I finished all of the noodles!
author: Elaine H.

description:
Who knew there was such good Thai food in the outer reaches of the Sunset? This place is really easy to miss and there are not too many tables inside.  Service is especially slow since there seems to be only one person working the front and probably only one in the kitchen too.  However, the food is mighty good.  The larb is full of flavor and also extremely spicy!  Only chicken and duck meat options for the larb though.  The duck fried rice is amazing, probably because of all the duck fat it takes to make it so flavorful. Just don't think about that and keep eating! Also tried the spicy green curry and salmon yang which were both just OK.  

Can't wait to come back and try more dishes.  Maybe takeout next time so there's less waiting.
author: Renee L.

description: Over priced and rude staff. Ordered a bowl of soup, appetizer and what I thought was a SIDE order of veggies. When I got to the restaurant, my bill was $30! I explained I just had ordered a la cart (direct translation of a la carte--listing or serving food that can be ordered as separate items, rather than part of a set meal ) from their menu. She explained that means making a small portion into a large portion! I paid $12 for sautéed broccoli! Rip off! She refused to take it off my bill and told me I had to pay the 30 dollars! I used to love this place and I come very often, but I will not be returning after that experience.
author: Chelsea S.

description: I order Cottage Fried Rice from this place at least twice a month. I've missed them dearly since they've been on vacation this July. I can't wait for them to reopen. Every host has treated me so nicely that I'd almost forgive them if the food was bad, but it's not. It's also great food. This place rules.
author: Jon G.

description: Simply amazing food! Everything we had here tasted amazing from coconut soup to curry to meat dishes! I don't usually leave reviews but this place was too good not to rate.
author: Maria M.

description: Food just wasn't that great, unfortunately. Pad See Ew was a bit bland, which is unusual.
author: Emily B.

description:
My boyfriend and I just moved into the neighborhood and this place has quickly turned into our favorite. My favorite dishes so far are the Tom Yum noodle soup and the duck noodle soup. My bf loves their duck fried rice.

It never gets too packed here. I hate crowded restaurants and waiting to be seated. The prices are very reasonable. Nothing is over $12. 

The ambiance is chill and their playlist is great. One night they were playing slow jams (ie Brian McKnight, Erykah Badu), another night they were playing old classics (ie Billy Joel, Fleetwood Mac). Music may not matter to you guys, but my bf and I huge music buffs.
author: Justina L.

description:
My friend and I stumbled into this place after walking through countless 'cafés' and 'sandwich shops', like, is it really that hard to find an actual restaurant? 
The place was really small and there was only one waitress working thy evening, I started to expect the worse. The server was actually really polite and attentive, whenever my glass even a tad bit empty, she was there again refilling it and asking if we needed anything else. 
I ordered an amazing meal, with Catfish as the center piece, and my friend ordered the yellow curry. I fell in love with that meal, I was even tempted to lick my plate, it was amazing. 
I can't wait to return, it's the perfect little spot for a nice dinner near the beach.
author: Vee D.

description: My favorite Thai in SF! The food is great. The prices are good. The owner and the employees are the sweetest. I've been to fancier spots but there's a magical energy in this little place that keeps me coming back again and again:)
author: Jacob S.

description: Quaint restaurant located in a sleepy section of San Francisco. I felt wonderful being able to eat a meal in silent reflection.
author: Mark O.

description: First time in, definitely coming back. My lady had the pumpkin curry and I had the garlic noodles with BBQ duck. Great portions per price and flavor was plentiful. I would be interested to find out what was all done in house. Stay tuned for round two.
author: Matt H.

description:
Best Thai in SF, IMO.

I lived down the street from this place for like a year and never went inside because the outside awning looks so sketchy. I'm dumb. This place rocks and is very affordable. Everything I've tried here has been better than good, it's been great.

So far i've tried:
Laarb
Glass Noodles and Pork
Red Curry
Panang Curry
Duck Curry
Duck Fried Rice
Pineapple Fried Rice

The service is very friendly and they do a very good job about knowing ingredients and accommodating dietary needs. I don't eat gluten, dairy, or eggs and they've always been able to guide me and work around my restrictions. They even have gluten-free tamari soy sauce they will use in lieu of wheat-based soy sauce. I have even had them come back to my table after placing my order and inform me that the waiter's knowledge was wrong and the kitchen notified him that, indeed, the dish in question used a non-gluten-free sauce. This double-check was very comforting and very valuable to someone like me who would have gotten sick otherwise.

Great for takeout too! 

Two people can easily get out of here full and happy for under $30 including tip. We usually end up spending under $25 for two. Highly recommend!
author: Johnson M.

description:
Full disclosure: my opinion is completely bias because I'm very good friends with the chef, Vina. But, she was not aware for whom she was preparing the dish. I can assure you a pleasant dining experience with their ambiance, fine ingredients, and excellent preparation. 

I ordered the Mushroom Garlic entrée with brown rice from the vegetarian section of their menu. I know Vina loves garlic so I was expecting it to be a bit overpowering. The first thing I noticed about the meal were the colors. It included five vibrant colors from the different types of mushrooms, decoratively cut carrots, both white and green onions, the tan of the tofu, and the red hot chili peppers. The ocean blue plate provided a finishing touch of color. 

Half of the eight tables in this small restaurant were occupied while I ate my meal. At least six people came in to pick up orders-to-go. This didn't stop the only waitress from providing decent service. Don't let the meager exterior or interior decorations deter you from dining here. It is all about the taste.
author: Ken R.

description: Tom kah and pineapple fried rice were decent, but the pumpkin curry was too soupy, lacking vegetables, and the pumpkin was not sufficiently cooked and therefore hard. Too spicy for my taste, which I wouldn't expect in this type of curry. Service and music were pleasant. All in all this place really needs to bring their food up several notches. I won't be coming back.
author: Marcos S.

description:
Literally best Thai food you will ever have, and I mean that. I get takeout from here ATLEAST 2-3 times a week. Everything I have tried is absolutely outstanding. 

Pad see ew: flawlessly done, not sure what they do that's different besides once you've have theirs you won't like other Thai places.

All curries: perfect, spicy but not holly crap I need milk.

Garlic noodles with chicken: can't ever go wrong. 

Fried veggie spring rolls: I've never found any better. 

This is a Gem for people who live in the sunset. There's no dish you order that you won't love. Only thing I wish they did was delivery or online ordering. But I guess that would change the charm of this old school family run and owned business. Love love love.
author: Morgan S.

description: An unexpected jewel in the outer sunset. Just enough food to feed one person only.  Too bad for that, becuz i like to share when the serving size is enough.. i also like the the fact that their report card was a 98! I would come back for that alone..
author: DNesha H.

description:
The food was awesome !! The portions were good and the taste is excellent. I have a thai girlfriend and she approved the restaurant so i believe it is indeed very, very good !
The staff is extremely nice and helpful.
author: Ashish N.

description: Pretty good thai food and curry spot.  Staff and service is always very pleasant.  Seating can be limited at times, as the location only has a limited number of tables.  Also great for take out!
author: T. E.

description: 4 different dishes were ordered here for a dinner with friends. Noodles and poultry dishes were killer, and I mean literally the quality and plating of the food was extremely good! Server took care of us and they leave a refrigerated water bottle on e table for easy of drinking and bussed all dirty plates in a timely manner! Quick service with food that packed great flavor, hot a spicy if that's what your into its gonna be great! Thanks again
author: John R.

description:
Last month was my very first trip to San Fran. My girlfriend and I were at a hotel around the corner and walked in the immediate area for a place to eat. We were surprised to find this little gem tucked away between some other businesses; it was a tight fit for the restaurant. It was a cool, candle-lit, chill atmosphere. Our waitress greeted us right away. I've heard that everything is more expensive in San Fran, but the menu wasn't over-priced. We started with the tom yum noodle soup, actually we split the dish; it was a great appetizer. Our main courses were really good, also the Thai iced tea. 

 The dining area is really narrow because the restaurant is kind of small, but it wasn't jam packed, so it worked out just right. I'm a fan and would definitely go back. Good service, good food, decent prices, great night-time atmosphere.
author: Matt R.

description:
Alright folks, listen up. This thai place is right down the street from my house and I am obsessed. Not only is it quaint and extremely mellow, but the food is absolutely delicious. I'm a vegetarian, so I love when I have options that don't make things confusing. The ingredients seem 100% fresh and local and I always leave satisfied. So when outerlands has an hour wait, go a few doors over for a nice little meal!

What I reccommend:
Tofu appetizer
Green curry with tofu
Pad thai with tofu
Spicy vegetable pad see yew (sp?)

GO!
author: Bree G.

description:
Came here for dinner

Pad Kee Mow
They ran out of the flat noodles so they asked me to sub it to the thin pad thai noodles. I went with the beef option but when it came out though, it looked like the noodles were drenched in gravy/liquid. My palate could not decide if I was eating noodle soup or a sauteed dish. 2.5/5

red pumpkin curry
The curry was very watery and bland and did not have much flavor. The vareity of veggies was decent but the ratio of liquid to veggie/chicken was significantly skewed towards the bland liquid. 2/5

Overall, if this place was a better value I would give round this place up to 3 but food wise they are below average. I probably will not be coming back
author: Robert Y.

description: Quiet place, good food, decent prices, efficient staff. Nice local place and the locals go here. Give it a try.
author: Sue C.

description: Chicken noodle soup so much flavor and green curry chicken spicy but great! Thai iced tea and sweet and sour chicken had tons of veggies and flavor! Best of all amazing service!
author: Nancie M.

description:
So good!!! Cute place close to the beach with some of the best Thai food I've ever eaten.

Standouts
-garlic noodles with bbq chicken (amazing)
-green curry (perfectly spicy)
-tom yum soup (also wonderfully spicy - not too, just right)

The dimly lit ambiance and decor is very cool, and the owners/staff are so welcoming and truly make you feel like family.  A hidden gem in the outer Sunset. Love!
author: Kim W.

description:
The food is just ok.

The people who work there are really really nice but the food is just meh.  And the ambiance/vibe of Thai Cottage is also just meh.  

I wish I could say more but other than the nice people who worked there it was all so meh - and I can meet nice people on the street so it just needs to be stepped up, plain and simple.
author: Dizzy L.

description: Creat neighborhood place!!  Cozy, friendly service, fair prices, and the food is amazing.  We tried the crispy spring rolls and the shrimp pumpkin curry.  Phenomenal flavors and we will go back for more!!
author: Luis M.

description: They were very accomodating. We walked in with a party of 7 on a Wednesday and sat us immediately. The service was great, after being at the beach all day we emptied pitchers of water and our server kept filling us up over and over. The pumpkin curry is what I had and it was really good (it is pretty spicy though, which I like).
author: Jason H.

description:
THE SERVICE: This place is great. The lady who is always working at the restaurant (is she the owner?) is very friendly and hospitable. The service at this place is fast and welcoming.  5 out of 5 stars.

THE FOOD: The food doesn't stand out as exceptional, but it's still totally worthwhile to go here. For the price, it's quite good. The green curry is one of my favorites, though. I'd give it 4.5/5 stars.

THE AMBIANCE: It's a small, well-furnished, intimately lit restaurant. Overall, I'd say it's pretty good, and the ambiance is much nicer than many thai restaurants in its price range. 4.5/5 stars.
author: John M.

description:
Like many, we wandered over after Outerlands had turned us away (in a super ass-y way- So ass-y, I doubt we will try to go back). Really, Thai Cottage could not possibly ask for a better location in this respect.

We were the only two in the restaurant on a Saturday right around 2.30, which seems like it would be totally weird, but it wasn't. 

The food was excellent- We got crispy spring rolls, my husband got some sort of curry that he really seemed to enjoy, and I got the garlic noodles with bbq chicken. Nothing super fancy, but everything was perfectly done.

Fortunately we're moving into a place less than 2 miles away, because I definitely want to go back.
author: Amanda P.

description: We've been back twice in three days. We would have gone three times but they are closed on Tuesday. Thai Cottage is not a fancy place, but they are kind and the food is delicious. Duck fried rice, satay, spicy eggplant, curry, and my favorite the Tom Ca Guy soup. We will be back.
author: Laurie M.

description: Visiting SF and found this place close to where we were staying.  The food is pretty authentic, with good selection of typical dishes priced around $10 a dish.  The dining room is small, but really quaint.  We were there on a Saturday night and were able to get seated quickly.  We ordered Larb (delicious and spicy), Pad Thai (noodles slightly underdone and thinner than most varieties but delicious sauce), and sticky rice with mango/sticky rice with coconut ice cream (both were awesome!!).
author: Lisa B.

description:
Got this local place for takeout. Really fast and delicious. We tried the pumpkin curry and chicken pad se yeu (?). Both were delicious and straightforward Thai. 

I'm lucky enough to have several Thai options near my place but these prices and tastiness are solid enough that I will totally come back.
author: Adrianna M.

description:
I love this place! This has to be my new favorite Thai restaurant. My boyfriend introduced me to this place. He has been eating here for awhile, and he is great friends with the owner. I met the owner, Sabrina, as well; she is a delight. She is extremely friendly! Aside from that, their food is amazing.

We ordered prawns in a blanket, mild yellow curry and chicken gra prow grob; however, we ordered crying tiger and their catfish during our previous visit. My favorite has to be the catfish and the chicken gra pro grob. I cannot get enough of it. We finished our plate and licked it clean. For dessert we ordered the sticky rice! I love how the mangoes were just right in complimenting the sticky rice. That as well was also devoured. 

The atmosphere of the place is just wonderful. The colors and decoration truly compliment the thai restaurant. My boyfriend said they recently remodeled, and it looks fantastic. We will be going back here soon!
author: Hazel N.

description:
Yes, I had better Thai.
The Garlic Noodle WAS TERRIBLE!!!
I didn't taste garlic at all and the noodle was all tangled, Oh Man I really hate eating tangled thin egg noodle.
Well, basically, when noodle gets tangled, it means that you don't know how to cook egg-noodle correctly, period.
It is like you don't know how to rice.
it means that the cook doesn't know how to saute egg noodle properly.
That's all.
The cook doesn't know how to cook thin egg noodle.
I don't know how the cook got the position here.
Even I can make the dish exactly the same.
Jeesus Chist!
Disappointed very much.
And the price is not really reasonable.

I don't really care of Thai food so much any more.
It was so-in, in late 90's.
The curry dish gets boring lately.
And I just like Japanese curry better.
Sorry for say this and I know it's not propriety for me to say.
And I like Vietnamese and Barmese are better. 
No offense to Thai people, I actually liked the service.

And I like Thai people. I have a friend who from Thai fro crying out loud.

Just it's not so appetite, for me, any more, That' all. 

I think this review is the 1st time for me to feel bad writing 2 star review because the service was really good.
I maybe come back.

I'M SORRY!
author: Nobu K.

description:
So hungry after apartment hunting for the past 5 hours!  

Thai sounded fab, so here I am.... Thai iced tea made special with coconut milk & the Jasmine rice, Chicken w Spicy chili sauce and extra veggies.  Totally hitting the spot!   :-)
Still hungry, so I ordered Red Curry & side of brown rice. I didn't quite finish the 2nd order, so had a small take home box when I left.  :o)
author: Chylene K.

description:
Everything we ate was amazing! And really low prices. 

Really quiet on a Friday night so if you're looking for a more lively place you might want to go down the street. But if you're looking for a nice neighborhood restaurant, friendly service, and great Thai food at great prices this is the place to go!
author: Brianne H.

description:
After going to Thailand for our honeymoon, the hubster and I felt like short of booking another flight back, we would never again taste authentic Thai food, until...we were told it would be an HOUR AND A HALF wait to get a table at Outerlands and came across Thai Cottage Restaurant.

Truth be told, of course it's not like eating in Thailand, but it's the closest we've found in the city and east bay. It's delicious, non-greasy, just right portions, and the staff is very friendly and warm. I highly recommend this place!
author: Emi I.

description: I've never written a review for any place but this place definitely deserves one. It was my first time trying Thai food and I enjoyed it.! I had the the Cottage Chicken and it taste great as well as the ice Thai tea.! Coming back FOR SURE.!
author: Jonathan S.

description:
After attending Hardly Strictly Bluegrass Festival at golden gate park, I was in the mood for thai and decided to try Thai Cottage for the first time. I really love this area of outer sunset because there are a lot of little restaurants to try. 

When first walking in, I wasn't expecting the restaurant to be so small. But I liked the intimate, cozy atmosphere. Our server was kind and sweet. We ordered; fish balls- not my favorite. Duck fried rice- really tasty and large portion. Pumpkin curry- loved the large chunks of pumpkin and the spicy kick. Overall, the food was very good and I look forward to trying Thai Cottage again!
author: Megan K.

description: After visiting here today, I found this restaurant to be just okay. Upon entering the restaurant the first thing that stuck out to me was the ambience/decor. They had candles on each table, making Thai Cottage a romantic atmosphere that is perfect for dates, and the bottle of water is cool too! I also thought that the service was decent, although the waiter was a bit shy, she was definitely very nice and helpful. Unfortunately, despite all of these good qualities, I found the food to be rather disappointing. The pad thai had an overpowering taste of tomato sauce, my boyfriend found an eyelash/eyebrow hair in his prawns, the prawns didn't taste very fresh, and the portions are small. So although I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant, I will most likely not be coming back.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Sabrina: Sweetest lady who owns the restaurant ever! She was so kind to us especially since my friend knew her personally. 

Small place but the atmosphere was relaxing. Small candle in the middle with soft music.

Food was fantastic. I'm not a big curry fan but I tasted the red?? curry my friend ordered with rice. AMAZING.I had some kind of noddle with chicken in it. The best noodles i ever had. Wasn't oily or greasy. Thai tea was delish! Not too sweet and had enough taste to it.

Most definitely coming back!
author: Sharon L.

description:
I came on Saturday night with restaurant.com coupon, was warmly greeted by one of the host. 
It's calm and pieceful inside the restaurant. Food, to me, is extremely great. I got grilled shrimp salads, duck noodle soup and my friend got pineapple duck curry, and skewers. Definitely I recommend this place if you are a fan of Thai food. 
Every dish is well presented and tasty. So, they deserve 5 stars. :)
author: Kat N.

description:
Thai Cottage's homey atmosphere aptly reflects its name, and its winning combination of well-executed dishes and kind, gentle service establishes it as the prominent Thai restaurant in the Sunset.

The juxtaposed cooling slivers of green papaya and face-flushing chili lime dressing lends an irresistible magnetism to the Papaya Salad, successfully drawing you back throughout the meal.

The tamer but more flavorful chili lime sauce accompanying the Salmon Yang steals the lime (heh) light from the well-seasoned but slightly dry fillet.

Supremely tender chunks of duck soaked in a curry much too powerfully spicy and flavorful to forgo the companionship of rice grace the Duck Pineapple Curry.

The Pad See Ew is typically reminiscent of a sweeter Chow Fun - while appropriately flavored, is thoroughly uninspiring.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The perfect word for this iota of an eatery is . . . charming.
I have dined at Thai Cottage at least a dozen times as of this writing. It was certainly my intention to Yelp them earlier - but, time slips.

First things first - the PERFECT and I do mean perfect, Coconut Milk ever.
In other, unmentionable places, I've had CM that is cloying, redunkulously sweet or weakly watered to the point of, well . . . pointlessness.
Every dish with CM served here is exquisitely balanced. A light, tropical thread that weaves it's way through the quixotic collaboration that is Thai spicing.

Intimate, private and filled with western sunshine in the late afternoon - you know, those afternoons that only the Outer Sunset can produce, sans fog.

The entire endeavor laced together by Sabrina - fondly thought of, by us, as the Tinkerbell of Oceania. (She's never once, forgotten my name, despite my approximately once every 5 weeks irregularity)

Some tidbits to leave you with....
Crispy Basil
Curried Duck
Papaya Salad

You must - dinners only, but still.
author: Timothy M.

description: I absolutely love this place. It's my girlfriend's and my favorite thai restaurant. Why? The pad thai is excellent & we love the catfish dish, the sauce is so good. We love it because it's generally not to busy, we can always sit down, however, we'd love for people people to know about this place.  The staff is incredibly nice too, we come out to eat here all the way from the inner richmond area.
author: Wes M.

description:
In a city inundated with Thai restaurants this place sets itself apart in several ways. It is a small, intimate restaurant located just a couple blocks from the Ocean way out in the sunset district. It's very convenient to Golden Gate park. The ambiance is cozy and welcoming. The service is over the top kind and attentive. The food - just plain delicious. Many people consider Thai to be "too spicy" but this place is a good example of well-balanced flavor profiles prepared to your spiciness preference. They have many of the standard Thai dishes but also some real stand-outs such as "cottage duck", a preparation that reminded me of Peking duck. The Thai beef salad was amazingly good with a bright, vinegar-based sauce. The crispy chicken with noodles was also delicious - my kids loved that dish. For dessert - coconut creme brulee - outrageously good.

Highly recommended. There is some reference here on Yelp that this place is closed and that is inaccurate.
author: Clay K.

description:
I've made five trips to Thai Cottage to date. They are in my neighborhood and they've morphed into my choice for my neighborhood go to place.

Thai Cottage is small, I mean really small. Maybe 12 tables at the most. It's clean, warm and comfortable. The owner, Sabrina, is extremely accommodating and inventive with her recipes. The menu is small thus making their dishes and the ability to maintain quality manageable. They are conveniently located right on a stop for the "N". If you can get on the MUNI, you can get to Thai Cottage. 

My wife and I have had every appetizer they make. All damn good. On the typical outer-Sunset cold drizzly day, their Duck soup puts a smile on your face and warms the heart. My favorite dish in Thai Cottage is the spicy catfish. It rules and I do not hesitate to order it. My wife always opts for the curry dishes and loves them.

If you feel adventurous and want to make the trip out to the edge of the country, you have to try Thai Cottage.  

You will not make a mistake dining here.
author: Wayne B.

description: I had bought a Restaurant.com coupon. I went on a Saturday at 5:30pm and ordered the pad thai, CATFISH, Garlic Noodle with BBQ Chicken, Duck Cottage and Tofu Broccoli. Everything was tasty. The true standout dish was the CATFISH = Yummy! I had better Garlic Noodle with BBQ Chicken at Green Bamboo. I enjoy heavy garlic. There wasn't much duck for the Duck Cottage. It was more of an appetizer than a main dish. Service was slow with only one waitress. Small, cozy, and tiny restaurant. I enjoy watching the fireplace heater. It sure keeps the restaurant warm. Nice they don't rush you. Eat at leisure. :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description: Delicious, great ambience, friendly staff. Portions were small though, and not very inexpensive.
author: Kate L.

description:
Portions are too small. 

Flavor was, meh. 

The place is cute and good for a quiet night. We saw a few people come get take out. Waitress was very sweet. The food was not impressive. We ordered 7 dishes, and they tasted okay. Just don't think you're getting good value, nor are your taste buds dancing. Perhaps, I expected too much from all it's awesome reviews.
author: M C.

description:
We had a great veg meal, though I wish the tofu in both dishes wasn't fried. Anyway, it was really yummy and beautifully presented. 

The service is very friendly, but sometimes slow, because there is only one person doing all the non-kitchen work.

The place is also very nicely decorated.

We shall return!
author: Veg V.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco! Located about 3 blocks from the beach, it's a cute little restaurant that's perfect for a quiet date night. Food's always amazing and the customer service is just great. They're always so friendly. Good quality Thai food for a good price.
author: Marie C.

description:
So I am confused how to rate this place...
I dined alone and had one dish: Tom Yum Noodles $8.50
4/5 Food: delicious, very spicy just how I like it, but no mushrooms, red onion, or enough cilantro. Noodles were cooked to perfection. There were two very small shrimp, one fish ball, and about a palm-full of ground chicken. It filled me up and was very flavorful but could use some more ingredients.
2/5 Service: There was only one woman working alone at 6:30 on a saturday night. Not enough service staff. But I almost feel bad giving such a low rating because she was very VERY nice and was trying her hardest (despite there only being 8 tables in the place). From order to check processing it was a 55 minute experience. Fine that I wasn't in a hurry but I can usually be in and out in half hour for a simple dinner like that. 
5/5 Ambiance: Very cute place. Small, quaint, clean, and pleasant. Looks like a recent paint job, pretty classy. 
So, overall the food had AMAZING flavor, but lacked ingredients. I will go back and try other dishes for sure. Looks like an extremely veg friendly menu. Service took way too long but was excessively friendly.
author: Kayleen R.

description:
Came here with a friend who wanted to venture out of her neighborhood. Her first time hanging out in the sunset aka the avenues. 

We started out with fried tofu with peanut sauce. I could have taken it or left it. Nothing to write home about, wish it had more taste in the tofu, but dipping it in the peanut sauce helps. 

My friend ordered a glass of red wine, but the waitress accidentally bought out a glass of red wine and white wine. I thought this was a sign for me to sip some white wine and take it off their hands! Was perfect for sipping slowly through the Thai deliciousness.

We had basil beef with green beans and red belpeppers. I'm not a fan of green beans, but the dish was good.

Also tried Penang curry with chicken. Yummy! Very spicy, beware. It's really good though, but you can ask them to dial down the hotness :)

Then ordered Pad Thai with shrimp. Really good, a decent staple. I love anything related to Pad Thai. 

So we were stuffed to the brim, could have done without one plate. All of them we shared. It was about 48.00 without tip, pretty good for ordering wine, appetizer, and 3 entrees.
author: Ally W.

description: Flavorful, excellent food :)
author: Geri W.

description:
Thai Cottage is another gem in the Outer Sunset. 

Easily missed by its unassuming exterior, I'm glad I finally tried it. Walking in I was met with tranquility (+ a touch of tune) and a friendly smile.

I had a craving for pumpkin curry. It's rich flavors and spice packed a nice, flavorful punch over brown rice. 

I really enjoyed my meal, especially on the dark and stormy night I was there. I look forward to trying other dishes.
author: Cathy K.

description:
in this world divided between noodle people and rice people, i'm a noodle person.  even so, i have a mental hierarchy of noodle.  for example, pad thai precedes pad see ew.  

imagine my surprise when the pad see ew here knocked my socks off!  there were no cheap frills (bean sprouts, random cabbage pieces, etc) obscuring the silky, voluptuous noodles.  and the overall flavor was clean and on point.  i scoffed at the fried rice.  noodles 4 lyfe!

but then other people started swooning over the fried rice.  what the what?  i decided to investigate...

WHAT IS HAPPENING TO MY WORLD????  the duck fried rice is life-changing!

i don't know who i am anymore, but i do know that after trying 3 apps, som tom salad, the tom yum soup, and over 5 dishes, this tiny, smiley, shoebox place tucked into the misty arms of outer sunset has some of the freshest, non-greasiest, classiest, tastiest thai food i've had outside of thailand.  frankly, this stuff is better than most places in phuket where i had some pretty kick-ass rad na noodles...

back when i was a noodle person.  damn.  and now back my existential crisis...
author: Sandy C.

description:
I don't live here so I did a yelp search for some lunch. They didn't have a patio for my dog so we were going to get it to go and eat on a bench outside. The girl working was so sweet and offered to let us eat on their little patio out back. We had the patio to ourselves & felt like we were having lunch at a friend's house!

The food was also great! I had spicy green tofu curry & some of the coconut milk soup (forgot what it's called). Boyfriend had the cottage fried rice & my friend had the pumpkin curry. Everything was delicious!!
author: Jessica C.

description: The food was amazing, never enjoyed Thai food the way I did here. I usually get full before I finish half the plate, not this time, I finished everything even the soup. I ordered afterward a Thai iced tea and was great as well. The place is small yet cozy playing cool music. The hostess was very nice and helpful.I will definitely go back again.
author: Shaima B.

description:
With less than five reviews, I thought I had discovered a new restaurant--a Thai one, at that...  

Not so.  Thai Cottage has been around for four years.  Business seems to be going strong, even with a lack of promotion and the fact that not many people want to leave civilization to trek all the way to the Outer Sunset.

The inside room temperature is warmer than usual.  What would normally make for uncomfortable dining, is actually a welcome respite from the cold and fog that lurks outside.  At a maximum seating capacity of 18, it's a small restaurant.  Take a minute or two to peek at their carefully designed website; it's not only useful for their menu, but also very informative on Thai cuisine.

Since Thai is few and far between in this area, this place is excellent for those in the neighborhood.  While the food is above average, I wouldn't recommend a pilgrimage here unless you take advantage of their gluten dishes.  Their veggie selection is plentiful.  Move over, Mekong; the veggie satay here is worth the five stars, alone.
author: Marsha Z.

description: You might have to wait for a while on a Saturday night, but is worth it! We had the calamari, the Duck Cottage and the fried banana coconut ice cream dessert, it was all so delicious and so fresh. Happy tummy. :-)
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Get thee to the avenues.  What an unexpected treat. We intended to hit the Outlanders (closed) and stumbled into the thai cottage. Everything we had off the  menu was deeeelicious and the sweet young man who served us was jus delightful. The cottage is pretty new and i really want to impress the freshness and flavors just burstin out of every dish.
Can't wait to enjoy their traditional dishes  again and again.
small quaint and parking was good for our mid week lunch.
Thanks Thai Cottage.
author: dana s.

description:
I came here last night and all I can say was that it was fantastic! The flavors were so fresh and not masked by salt or oil. The pineapple duck curry was perfect and I am picky about curry. The waitress Sabrina was so sweet and she made my night all the better. We ordered the duck curry and just asked to substitute the duck for chicken and Sabrina was more than willing to cater to our every need. Ask for the brown rice it is so good and much healthier than white rice.

I will be going to this place many many many times. I will also recommend it to all my SF friends! 

Thank you Sabrina for being such a great waitress! You made me happy
author: Aneliese R.

description:
I've only had their pad thai, but it's pretty damn good. Ugh, I know it's awful to give a review based on one dish, but I'm freakin' doing it. I'm glad my mom and pop only live a block away from here. Beats the hell out of Marnee Thai (which is overrated by the way) for sure. Plus, it's hard to find many restaurants in the Outer Sunset near the beach, especially GOOD restaurants.

I know the location isn't the best for business, but I really hope Thai Cottage is here to stay. =)
author: Cristal G.

description: This place is fatastic.   Especially their curry.   No reason not to go and try.   Amazing staff, great location and excellent food.
author: Johnny C.

description:
So we were going to try Sri Thai after a day of fun in the sun, but Sri Thai was closed, which brought us to this place, Thai Cottage.

The place is definitely small, and definitely quiet. Not at all equipped for big groups, so when our group of 7 walked in, I felt we were a bit outta place. But not bad for a early sunday lunch, or maybe a first date.

Anyways, service was a bit slow since there's only one person working on the outside. But she was chill and nice. The dishes came out one by one, rather than all-together at once. I ordered the Tom Kha soup, which is not bad. A bit tangy, would order it again. D ordered a peanutty dish and a Thai coffee. The dish was okay, the coffee was a bit strong, but then again, not really that big a fan of coffee to begin with.

One thing that bothered me was the difference in the portions. One friend got almost all rice, while two dishes, almost the same, had completely different portions. Then again, this might have been because of the friend with the larger portion got tofu, while the other got a meat.

Prices are definitely reasonable. No more than 10 for any one dish. Overall, I approve.
author: Jessica H.

description:
A great stop after a walk along the beach.

I came in here at around 8:30PM with my lady date.  We'd planned on visiting the restaurant given its high yelp rating and proximity to the N-Judah stop.

For about 90% of our visit we were the only ones in the restaurant (about 25 seats total).  We really enjoyed the seclusion;  both of the waitresses present were super-friendly (and looked over every 30 seconds to make sure we were comfortable).

The food was quite tasty, and very well-priced.  We started with a dish of shrimp and salad.  Thank God for cilantro.  The plate was well spiced, and the prawns were cooked just fine, but there's nothing like eating any sort of protein with a bunch of cilantro on it.  Nothing.

For entrees, we had a bowl of curry noodle soup and THE MOST DELICIOUS ENTREE OF ALL TIME -- the chef's special stuffed eggplant dish.  I don't have a sharp tongue, I tasted chicken and more cilantro in the stuffing of the eggplant;  I can only conjecture that the rest of the stuffing was made of my childhood tricycle and Sunday afternoons.  The eggplant was cooked to perfection, cooked like porterhouse steak.

Plus, beers for $3.25!

Don't miss this place.  Make a weekday beach walking date, and get yourself some chef's special eggplant dish.

Four stars for the great eggplant and service.  If I went back and found a few more gems on the menu I'd give it five.
author: Bill H.

description: All that I wanted and more.  Had the pumpkin curry at it was amazing.  Definitely hit the spot.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 1:30p... The restaurant was empty when my group and  I walked in, but it quickly gained some other customers within ten minutes of us sitting down.. Haha, that kind of scared me at the beginning. Anyway.
Ordered their Pad Thai with vegetables and tofu. Thai Iced Coffee. I gotta say, I was impressed by the Pad Thai. It's definitely really tasty and very nicely presented to you. You have the noodles & veggies on one side. The bean sprouts on another. And since the plate is split into thirds, you have the peanuts and spices (crushed pepper, etc) on another part of the plate. It's different since you can control how much peanut and spiciness you want, if anything. Usually whenever I order Pad Thai, 99% of the time everything is already mixed in. It was cool. I was amused. lol.
The Thai Iced Coffee was a nice treat. They definitely fill the mug up with the drink. (: 
I've only had one entree from here so I can't really judge their other entrees, but everyone else who ordered was quite satisfied. I'd say the only downside to this place is that it's pretty cozy and I can get kind of claustrophobic sometimes..
author: Susan Y.

description: Absolutely fabulous!  We've tried the pumpkin curry, green curry, pad thai, green papaya salad, duck over vegetables,  Tom kha soup, and the fried bananas with home made coconut ice cream. So good!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I love this place.  I used to live right down the street, and I really miss it.  

The food here is delicious.  My favorite is the chicken Pad Kee Mao, which is just spicy enough and has great flavor.    

The only downside is the service.  The waitress who is usually working is SUPER NICE, but when it's just her, and the place gets busy, you might be waiting a while.  But this problem is easily avoided if you go during non-busy times.
author: Abigail S.

description:
Get the Chicken Satay Appetizer. Chicken is perfectly seasoned and grilled, the sauce is nutty and complex, and the cucumber mini-salad will leave you wishing there were more. I had to discreetly sip the tiny bowl that housed the vinegar style dressing, so as not to waste a drop. 

This is a quiet, hole-in-the-wall restaurant, so don't expect a bustling atmosphere. Perfect for a date or a chill Sunday night with friends. Sabrina will treat you as if you were her closest relative, and your taste buds are in for a rousing experience.
author: William H.

description:
my freind John said this place was great, so the five of us including john went in. John said if Natasha likes it it has to be great and beautiful, since she is beautiful.
The food was amazing. we had all of the three soups plus the rice!
p.s. John was great hoping to see natatsha but no..but he had a great meal and another recommendation.
It is a little small but a cozy atomsphere, nice music too
author: barabara b.

description:
Hands down, this is the best place in the city to get Thai.  Go for the happy meal: get the yellow pumpkin curry, pad eggplant, and pad thai.  The flavors are rich and well balanced.

Yes, this place is small, but "whole in the wall" doesn't quite capture the ambiance.  Everything is immaculately clean, which is something I really appreciate.  The staff is always super friendly as well.

Some people have criticized that this place is always empty (implying that no one goes here).  And it is empty, but only because everyone orders takeout.  At any given time there's a queue of brown bags just waiting to be picked up.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
*crickets*

Usually I am wary walking into an empty restaurant, but I was so hungry the singing crickets did not make me hesitate.

The veggie spring rolls are something to miss. They were dry and bland and the dipping sauce was reminicent of orange marmalade.

*crickets*

The veggie pumpkin curry on the other hand was delicious. Green beans, buttery zucchini, firm broccoli, peppers and chunks of pumpkin in a savory/sweet curry sated my voracious appetite.  

The pan fried eggplant was also super tasty.  It was the perfect consistancy, which is difficult with eggplant.  It was a bit oilier than I prefer, but it was still inhaled by Jess and I in 10 minutes.

*crickets*

We took our full bellies home and left the crickets for the next patron.
author: Hayley W.

description: This is by far the best authentic Thai food in San Francisco, coming from someone who lived in Thailand. Sabrina, Air and the family are a rare and amazing unit running a unique and truly special place to dine. I have become close friends w these people and they have welcomed my family and friends as if they were their own. The Tom Kha Gai is phenomenal, green curry is spicy and amazing as it should be, shrimp rolls are great, pra rham also amazing, pineapple fried rice....I've literally eaten everything on this menu and have nothing short of rave reviews to give for all. Great for dates, family dinners, even bigger parties if you call ahead. Ultimately, you are really missing out if you look this place over.
author: Teresa V.

description:
I just got back from eating a delicious dinner at Thai Cottage and the best part of it all was it was free! 

Tonight was the soft re-opening of Thai Cottage. Sabrina, who an amazing cook and incredibly sweet, is the new owner there. Her and her husband were so friendly.

The food was great! Since it was the first day and it was a soft opening they did not have the whole menu ready but there were already many things to choose from. Tonight they were letting customers come in an get whatever they would like from the menu and it was all on the house. 

If you are in the outer sunset, go check it out!
author: James V.

description:
Delicious, delicious, delicious!

     The restaurant is nestled on semi-busy stretch of Judah St. in the Outer Sunset District.  Easy to bypass but once you discover the mouth-watering gem that is the Thai Cottage cuisine - my son & I were left with a happy, satisfied foodie appetite!
     The owners are a wonderful, very warm couple who take great pride in customer service and unforgettable tasting food.
author: jennifer t.

description: Very good food, nice atmosphere, and great service!  What more could you ask for?
author: Briar S.

description: Wonderful food filled with love and pride. Quick friendly service. The food is really fresh. The last customer that just walked out said that he could tell everything was just made in the kitchen. Its very noticeable. Come today, you will be glad that you did!
author: David P.

description:
The very definition of a hole in the wall restaurant, and a very quaint place indeed. I walked in and was immediately entranced by the smell of the food. Ten tables total, 2 of them seat 4, the rest seat 2.

Diamond in the rough material indeed. The food is great. Yellow curry is on point!
author: Jurem F.

description: Pretty good thai and reasonably priced.  The spicy green curry is yummy! :)
author: D P.

description:
I WOULD GIVE THIS PLACE 0 STARS IF I COULD!!!

Why? THEY TRIED TO STEAL MONEY FROM ME! (read on)

I ordered 2 items To Go, the Pra-ram and the Pad-Thai, which totaled $15.08 (I paid by debit card, wrote and signed for $15.08). After a few days, I checked my bank account and noticed the Thai Cottage charge had cleared for $21.08! yes...they took it upon themselves to STEAL $6 TIP FOR A TO GO ORDER!!! I did not sign for, nor approve any such tip. I knew something was fishy when the waitress didn't give me my "customer copy" of the receipt after I had signed theirs. TOO BAD for them I immediately wrote down on a piece of paper how much I had actually approved just in case I had to reference it later. I can't believe they had the nerve to tip themselves $6 on a To Go order of 2 items. I might not have noticed it if it was reasonable like say $2. I immediately filed a claim with my bank and am being given an instant credit of $6. Needless to say, I won't be back and I'm WARNING all my fellow yelp users to BEWARE of Thai Cottage!

Oh and PS...The food was mediocre at best. I've had better Thai food for cheaper...Definitely not good enough to warrant the outright thievery they TRIED to get away with. (And yes it is only $6, but it's the principle of the matter)
author: Michelle H.

description: nothing too special, but just a nice local place for people to go to when they're craving thai.
author: Sharon H.

description: I brought my cousin here on her last night in San Francisco after reading all the great Yelp reviews.  When we arrived at this little hole in the wall, I knew it wasn't going to be a good experience.  There was only one waitress, and she looked really frazzled.  It took her several minutes to clean a table for us, and then after we were seated, it took her about 10 minutes for her to come back and give us some menus.  We literally had to flag her down just to give her our order.  Then, two of the dishes we wanted to order were no longer available.  What?? It was like an hour until close.  You really don't have spring rolls anymore? I give the place one star for the food.  It was pretty darn good and the sauces were really flavorful.  I really wanted to like this place, but the slow and spotty service is enough to keep me away.
author: Julie P.

description: I love Thai cuisine. After my first visit at Thai Cottage restaurant, I can't help going back to taste more different dishes.  In the recent 2 weeks, I visited four times there. So far my favorites are Pad Thai, Tom Yum Soup, Tom Yum Noodle soup and Duck Fried Rice. I personally think those dishes are must try if you visit Thai Cottage in first time. The portion of dishes is good as well with the price. Actually, this restaurant is not too big and fancy, but it is comfortable to have a dinner date.
