Also, it is good for ordering takeouts for people who are living in the neighborhood.
author: Wendy W.

description:
One of the best Thai cafes I have been to. Everything seasoned perfect- not too hot but a lot of yummy garlic. It has character as well as the staff are all smiles and serve with style for such a small unassumaing cafe. Must go to if you like crisp veggies cooked perfect in garlic. 
This will be a regular place for me to visit for now on.
author: Debi C.

description:
On a cold night, stopped in to have the duck curry and the beef pra rham.  Pretty good, but not spectacular.  If you are in the neighborhood, Thai Cottage will do the trick.   

I really prefer Pagan on Clement, but maybe it is unfair to compare the two with Pagan being the combo Thai and Burmese.
author: Glenn L.

description: Thai Cottage is one of the best restaurants in the Ocean Beach area.  I am always greeted and seated right away by the attentive staff.  I love their spicy basil beef and crispy chicken fried rice.  The Tom Yum is good, but not amazing.  The Larb is decent, but not my favorite.  The only major drawback is their severe lack of good beer.  I would love to spend my hard earned money on a nice IPA or even a Sierra Nevada to enjoy with my meal, but here you are forced to slum it with Heinekin or tasteless Thai beer.
author: Andy Z.

description: This place is straight up excellent! I'd highly recommend it to anyone in the area for some good authentic Thai cooking, with a "homestyle" feeling. The food here is delicious!! It has a lot of seafood dishes with the curry. I'll have to come back to try the other dishes!
author: Arnold W.

description: This is the best Thai I've had in the bay area, and it's shockingly cheap! Not gross-ambiance-but-good-food-might-as-well-take-out cheap, but very reasonable with normal portions in a cute spot. Sabrina will always take great care of you, and the dining area is beautiful and peaceful. The first night I was in SF I came here (unwittingly) right before closing--the kitchen had already shut down--and I was going to leave but Sabrina said "I would never let anyone go hungry!". We are here more than any other place to eat out in SF.
author: Billy S.

description: We came here because Outerlands was closed and I am very glad we did! This place is little and cozy and the waitress is one of those happy people you can't help but smile right back at. Basil tofu had just the right amount of heat, everything tasted real fresh, and the portions were filling but not stuffing. My only complaint is that they ran out of coconut creme brulee before we could order one.
author: Julia N.

description:
I really wish I could give it 5 stars, I really do. The service is great; the waiter was really friendly but honestly he was plain creepy. My parents and I couldn't decide whether he was gay or just weird. The place smelled like wet-towel when we walked in...not good.

The food was awesome, though. It was as good, if not better, than most other Thai places. Their prices are alright, but may be on the high side. It's incredibly sad that they charge for rice, since it would be impossible to eat any of their dishes without rice (they're not already served over rice), so it's like a hidden cost you don't see coming.

If you want good Thai food, you'll find it here, but don't be surprised if you are served by the strange waiter and it smells awful there.
author: Natalie L.

description:
Checked out this placed based on Yelp reviews...great neighborhood spot. We don't have many good Thai places in the Sunset and this one tops it off! Went for lunch...we ordered the Spicy Eggplant & Red Curry Chicken....bother were excellent! The lunch portions were a bit small compared to other places but the flavors were excellent!

We will be back...!
author: Daddy F.

description: As a Pad Thai fanatic, I've tasted hundreds.  This is the second best I've tasted, anywhere (the best was in Spokane, Wash.).  Freshly cooked, delivered to the table immediately.  Nice folks who pay plenty of attention to their customers.  I don't live in SF but go there at least once a month, and I'm glad I know a good restaurant that is reasonably priced.
author: Stan B.

description: The BEST Thai restaurant I have ever been to.  Do not be fooled by the exterior!  Once you step inside, the restaurant is nice and quaint, and the service is always excellent.  We have had the same waitress every time, and she is super sweet and helpful.  The curries are heavenly!  And the chicken satay is delicious...and its very affordable too!
author: Madison M.

description:
I was on the N Judah and the bf picked me up at the end of the line...we were hungry and didn't know what we were craving.

We saw Thai Cottage and thought...what the heck..thai sounds good right now..

The place is tiny...like maybe 8 tables tiny...there was only 1 other couple inside but the menu looked pretty good so we gave it a try.

We started off with:

Pla Goong - which was a basically a salad tossed w/ prawns, lemongrass, onions & mint leaves in a chili lime dressing...we both agreed the sauce was very flavorful and tangy...

Po Piah Goong - pretty much a springroll but very tasty

I ordered the Gai Yang - grilled chicken...normally this can be hit or miss as I've had really good grilled thai chicken that was moist and flavorful and I've had thai grilled chicken that was dry and full of bones, but the grilled chicken here was cooked perfectly and presented nicely..very good!

The bf got the Yellow Curry Lamb...it was delicious...the taste reminded me of the beef rendang at Lime Tree...so that was a plus!

Service was friendly and fast, I would definitely come back here to satisfy my thai food craving again!
author: Jade B.

description:
Perfect little neighborhood restaurant.  

TINY little place with no more than 10 tables, cute atmosphere and ambiance, quick service and friendly staff and yummy flavorful food at not overly expensive prices.  Everything we had was really good.  My favorite was the fried rice, it had an amazing flavor to it.  

Perfect place to come to for dinner if you live in the area.  And even if you don't, it may even be worth coming to the area for if you want to risk maybe not getting a table.  (it is a really small place)
author: Denise B.

description:
I love this place and never have they disappointed me. The service is genuine, attentive, and friendly. The food is better than most available. I love their Veggie Satay; it taste just like real meat!! All their curries are thoroughly delicious. I'd name favorites but I'd be naming almost everything on the menu. This restaurant is an almost unknown gem.

Their menu will please meat eaters and  vegetarians alike. There are extensive options for both!
author: Faye S.

description: Hands down BEST THAI FOOD IN SF!!!!!! The owner/waitress is easily the nicest person in the world, and the thai beers are amazing! If I could I would inject all of their curry straight into my heart. And best of all, great prices! Especially for such amazing food. I live close by and nothing makes me happier!
author: Nelson S.

description:
Finally, a good thai restaurant that...

-- is nonpretentious
-- is authentic
-- that cooks/presents the food with love(they even carve out little carrot flowers)
-- uses fresh ingredients(no more rancid tofu and sprouts)
-- serves the perfect portions
-- does not serve your rice or noodles too dryyy
-- is nongreasy
-- serves up dishes with a kick of flavorful spice
-- offers some tempting duck dishes(have yet to try, slated for next time)
-- does not fry underripe bananas 
-- serves patrons with warm smiles
-- would be a great place to grub after a day at the beach
-- is located right around the corner from my new apt
(of which I have yet to move in, but I thought I'd have a taste of the local scene)
-- is careful in packaging your takeout/leftover food
(I am savoring the idea of eating spicy takeout thai food in front of a fireplace overlooking the ocean on a frigid night..so excited about my new  location! )
author: Vicky P.

description:
This place is tried and true. I have eaten here more times than I can count and it has never been anything but delicious. I'm a curry person and can eat it everyday, but I've eaten here so many times that I've tried almost everything and...it is ALL good. If you love thai or are even new this is the place. 

Oh also their soup? It's so tasty you think you're imagining it.
author: Melody V.

description:
came back the next evening for dinner with my roommate, who was all yummed out by the pad thai i brought home for him.

had the duck pineapple curry again, delishness was most present. went really well with rice, not a drop of gravy was left to waste.

spring rolls for starters; non-greasy, dainty morsels. fried fresh, vegetable stuffing had a good crunch to it. whets the appetite for sure.

tom yum with prawns; loved that this soup was not chock full of items; a lot of mushrooms, some slices of tomatoes, onion slices, and prawns, alongside the ginger slices and lemongrass, etc. heat was definitely there, but it did not overwhelm, and had a good sour tang. overall clean, wonderful flavors. much like the tom yum i've had at no-frills thai restaurants run by thai families back home in malaysia.

spicy eggplant tofu...ZOMG. SHO YUMMYYY. just so delicious, i think it was cooked in a (black?) bean paste/sauce. eggplant was cooked perfectly. i salivate now thinking of it. the roommate hearts the fried tofu, and so did i. MMMMM. however, not spicy in the least. but still so amazing.

was eager to noms on the coconut creme brulee, but they ran out of it and also the sticky rice with mango dessert. we went for the remaining dessert, fried banana with ice cream. so good! the banana slices were fried expertly in the tempura-like batter, in little ball shapes. not excessively greasy, came out piping hot. went tremendously well with the coconut ice-cream....the hot-cold experience and mix of flavors were perfect.

must make more trips here for foodz and coconut creme brulee!
author: Eliza D.

description: Yummm.  I went here for an early dinner - the place was empty.  Ordered the Larb chicken, which was excellent and flavorful with a really nice kick.  I also got the pumpkin curry with tofu and vegetables - also very very good!  I kinda wish it had more pumpkin flavor beyond the delicious pumpkin pieces inside.  Good-sized portions of everything - I had plenty left over for tomorrow.  All in all, very good.  And the waitress was really nice!
author: Carly G.

description: Came here for a birthday. We took up almost the whole restaurant as it was super small. The waitress was super attentive and made sure we had water and insisted complimentary alcohol for the birthday girl. She even offered to split checks for all of us!!! Not many restuarants enjoy doing this! Well I love Thai food so I ordered my favorite, tom yum goong, papaya salad, pad si ew and mango sticky rice. Salad I asked for mild but it was a bit too spicy. It was not bad but portion was a bit small. Soup was okay.. It was also pretty small and didn't have much in it. The pad si ew was yummy and they use "gai lan" and not broccoli, which I prefer. The mango sticky rice.. you cannot ruin it. So I was happy. One of the people in my group didn't get their food until we were done so that was the bad part. Otherwise I would like to try their curry next time and maybe another appetizer.
author: Shirley Y.

description: cool little spot in the sunset, i usually don't make it out here but if I'm going for a hike nearby, I'll stop in for some thai food =)
author: Tiff W.

description: Their pumkin curry was very good, my other dishes were rather on the  bland side. I will try them again thou I might be a case of knowing what to order
author: johnny s.

description:
Right around the corner and a little diamond in the rough!  
Their duck noodle soup is just the thing on a cold, foggy night! I've been here several times, both with a large group and as a couple and have ordered takeaway and have never been disappointed.  
Service is always warm and friendly, with a menu that has great variety but doesn't take 20 minutes to read and understand.  The food always seems lovely and fresh and they are great at tailoring some of the hot dishes if you can't handle the spice!
author: Aimee W.

description:
3.5 stars for this place.  Their Thai food here is quite tasty compared to the flavors from other Thai restaurants I've been to.  I'd give it 4 stars but needed to knock it down for the reason below.

The price hurts.  One pad thai with shrimp, one pa-nang chicken curry, and one order of spicy angel wings + rice for 2 people totaled $30+tip.  An average of $10 per item (not including rice) is quite a stretch.  There's a reason why the restaurant does not get packed!!!
author: Randall L.

description: The pineapple fried rice is awesome and the girl behind the counter is so sweet...
author: kyle d.

description:
This is a cute little "shack" with friendly service and absolutely delicious Thai food. If you eat here, you MUST try the coconut ice cream with fried bananas. It is absolutely to die for! 

My only complaint is about their Thai style iced coffee. It was good, but it tasted like they used canned or bottled iced coffee. It would have been better if they brewed fresh coffee and refridgerated it.
author: Alex H.

description: I'm sorry to say this, especially because the woman who waited on us was so sweet (and I suspect she's one of the owners), but the food was much better before the restaurant changed hands a couple of months ago.  The old Thai Cottage had wonderful food.  The new Thai Cottage is just okay.
author: Cindi L.

description:
The both times I've been to this place with friends there wasn't anyone else in the room. But i must say the food is awesome. 

Excellent fried tofu topped with fried basil leaves and a sauce from heaven. And please try the gluten satay. OMG, vegetarians would love this place. If you're not...i'd say try the cuttlefish (w chili, garlic, basil) too. SO frickin good.

its affordable too. 5 dishes with rice and drinks for everyone came up to $14 per person.
author: Marcia O.

description:
I was craving Thai food a few weeks ago, so I ventured onto Yelp to find a yummy place not far from my house.  Thai Cottage popped up, and only 4 miles from my house!
Parking was a bit painful, but we found a spot near by.  The restaurant is VERY small and there was already a big party there, but our service did not lack!  The young waiter came over to take our drink orders then our food order.  The tom yum soup was SOOOOO good.  I could've eaten an entire order by myself!  We also ordered the paid thai and shrimp curry.  It was all very tasty, we even had leftovers between two of us.  
Due to the large party, it was a little slow after we got our drink order, but it was well worth the wait!  I can't wait to come back and try some more curries!
author: Rachael J.

description:
My husband and I went here last night and had a good dining experience.  The food was great and the service was wonderful.  As mentioned in other reviews, the place was completely empty which feels a little weird.  It happened to work well for us since I had my 10 month old with us and it was nice to know we weren't disturbing anyone else (not that she's that noisy.. but some people don't handle any baby noise well at all.)  We'll go back.
The only negative was that they brought us soup w/ tofu instead of the chicken we ordered.  It was still really good, just the wrong thing.
author: Leah M.

description: Big fan of the Pad Thai here.  I used to get my noodles at King of Thai noodle, but Thai Cottage always seems fresher and they even cost a bit less.  I love their soups too!  I had to try the pumpkin curry recently at my friends urging and I was pleasantly surprised.  Very friendly staff as well.
author: Shauna L.

description: Thai cottage is a great place to have a dinner of two or even have a small gathering. The food is one of my favorites. I never realized how much I liked Thai food until I started coming here. The customer service is great and don't have to wait to long for good food. I like many dishes I really recommend to give it a try. It will be good for your taste buds...;)
author: Rita M.

description: My friend and I came here on a Monday around 11am and we were the only ones here.  Usually  not the best sign for a restaurant to be empty, but then again, it was Monday morning.  We were gonna go to the Vietnamese crab place down the block, but they were closed, so Thai Cottage was our second option.  We weren't really picky though seeing as that our stomachs were growling at us.  We went in and it was very cozy and small, but not claustrophobic.  We ordered the chicken green curry (i think) and the chicken satay skewers.  It comes with 6 skewers.  We thought that was too much chicken so we asked if we could get half chicken satay and half beef satay. The waitress asked the cook and he said yes, so that's what we got, which I thought was really nice because we got to try something else.  The skewers were really good.  The curry I thought was alright.  The waitress was nice and polite as well. Overall, the restaurant was not a bad choice and I would recommend eating here.
author: Christina T.

description: Nice little place with good and inexpensive food. I will come back.
author: Vladimir P.

description: Thai Cottage is the bomb!  The food is made with love and you can tell: nice presentation, awesome flavor, and unbeatable prices ($7-9 dinners).  One of my favorite places to eat.
author: Brian H.

description:
Great place for a casual dinner after a day at Ocean Beach. The beef satay was very tender and tasty. Hub said his green curry was not as flavorful as some other places, but at least it wasn't overly sweet, which is a frequent problem at Thai restaurants. He was also disappointed that they didn't have plain sticky rice. I loved my eggplant stuffed with ground chicken and shrimp. The tamarind sauce was very sweet, but I left most of it behind on the serving dish and had just the right amount on my plate.

Parking in the area (at around 6:00 pm on a Wednesday) was surprisingly difficult. The restaurant's decor is pleasant, but being such a small space, it's rather claustrophobic. It was a warm night, so the door was propped open for much-needed ventilation, but the rumble and screech of the N-Judah did not add to the ambiance.
author: Donna L.

description: The building itself is pretty small with space for about 20 or so people. BUT, owner, Sabrina has made great use of the space at hand. Great home style Thai food. Its a bit out there on Judah being from Ingleside area, but the food is well worth the trip. I try to make it there at least once a week. Very friendly atmosphere and if you catch the restaurant on a slow day I'm sure you could chat it up with the ever so friendly staff. Love every dish I've had, here are a few: Garlic Lover's Prawns, Pad Se-Ew, Pad Thai, Yellow Curry, Pumpkin Curry and the Pra Ram.
author: Rudy B.

description: Good food and very nice waitress. The Tom Kha soup and spicy catfish were delucious. I recommend this restaurant for your Thai cravings.
author: Joann G.

description: Excellent service and exquisite food. Very small place, but I 've never seen it crowded. They make the usual Thai dishes with a special flair - they taste a little more complex and flavorful. They also have quite a few dishes I haven't seen in other Thai restaurants, and these are fab, too. They substituted tofu for gluten in one of our party's dishes, with no problems. Our favorite dish - the pumpkin curry: very savory, not too spicy, with chunks of sweet fresh pumpkin. I thought the prices were very reasonable - in any case, their menu (with prices) is on their web site, so you can judge for yourself.
author: Anna L. C.

description: Spicy catfish!! Wow... really excellent! Tofu satay a disappointment but only ordered that because I was with a vegetarian friend.
author: Kat S.

description: great food!  everything tastes fresh and well cooked, very affordable.  Small and sometimes they run out of stuff but I always leave happy!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
I've been to Thai Cottage probably a dozen times and I never really had a problem with the place.  It's small and very intimate place to have dinner or special occasions.  I've not been there for about 3 months because it's always a long trip for me to drive from San Jose to San Francisco just to have dinner but this time, we had a guest who came from out of state. My wife and I wanted to show him a good place to eat that is different from what he normally eat.  Since he likes Thai food and Thai Cottage was on our mind; we decided to drive to SF.  I am writing to let you know the food is excellent but don't ask the waiter for any recommendation because the dish he recommended us sucks ass. 

It's was a cold day so we all ordered hot tea which they do charge, I think it's $1 per person.  Like I said, I've been there a dozen times and they never did this before;  they limited the time I was able to refill my tea.  For crying out loud, it's tea and they are charging me and then limited me to 3 cups total.  The cup are small and when I only drink half way, the waiter refills my drink and he counts that as one refill.  

Our total dinner was about $68 and I don't think tea cost that much compare to how much we ordered.   They are losing my business for now.  I will come back probably longer than 3 months to see if my review did anything to change their business stupidity.
author: Johnny L.

description: Nothing spectacular or horrible about the food, it's your usual Thai fare.  My review is on the service.  When my gf and I got here there were only a few tables occupied, but by the time we sat and ordered the restaurant filled up.  There was only one guy working the front of the house (cashier, waiter, everything!)  So the service was really lacking, only b/c the guy was running around like a chicken with head cut off to please everyone.  I actually felt bad for him esp when I had to remind him to bring water and napkins and rice and things one shouldn't normally forget when serving customers at a restaurant.  It's the only time i've been here so don't know if this was an anomaly and his sidekick was out sick or something but prob won't be back anytime soon.
author: Ricky S.

description:
Honestly - Outer Sunset is so under-rated. There are so many cute restaurants out here and even cute shops popping up all over the place. This corridor of restaurants definitely has some of my favorite places in the Sunset.

Thai Cottage starts with a great family feel...a famiiy owned restaurant with a slight hole in the wall feel, but not in a dirty way. Food is flavorful, service is friendly, and the prices are not expensive. For the most part, the food has been a hit, but i've had a few misses (maybe certain things were too sweet). For the Sunset, you can't go wrong with this Thai eatery.
author: Jeannette L.

description: This restaurant was a nice surprise. Everything we ordered was delicious. Good service.
author: buddie l.

description: I came here with two friends. We decided to each pick an item and family style it. We came on a Monday at 7pm, it was pretty empty. We got beef satay, which I must say was just ok. I love thai food and I love satay so this place just didn't do it for me. My friend ordered pumpkin curry. I thought the curry wasn't bad. My other friend ordered the Kao Mhok Ga. I though this dish was ok, because the chicken in the dish was buried beneath the rice and actually seemed like satay chicken skewer chicken that they put there. The almonds were also a bit stale. For three dishes it was about $30 with tip, which I felt was pricey for Thai Food. I don't think I'll be coming back.
author: Annie P.

description: Unfortunately I discovered this place a month or so before I moved out of my studio apartment at 44th and Boring, so I didn't get to savor the best fried Tofu Gra Prow Grob I've ever eaten as much as I wanted to.  Someday if I have the time and the patience, I shall return to feast upon its glory.   If you have a date and want someplace random and far away to take them to, and aren't afraid of the N Judah, this would be a really good pick- even more of a bonus if they're a vegetarian.  I would consider it to be the best Thai in the city.
author: Marie S.

description: Came here twice for lunch take outs. I ordered pai see ew the first time and pad thai the second. They were both good, even though the portions were fairly small. However, the reason why I gave it a three is because the two times I was there, they screwed up on my change. In the first occasion, the waitress short changed me. The second time, the waiter overcharged me. Though the food tasted good, but the waiters need to be more professional.
author: Bon T.

description: found a band-aid in my food.  deal breaker!
author: Grant M.

description: The food is good and the wait staff is very nice. The food tastes fresh and I was told that MSG isn't used. Although I don't enjoy spicy food, I liked what I had. My friends who enjoy spicy food, were happy. What they don't have in service, they make up for with genuine niceness.
author: Diane H.

description: Great Papaya Salad and Pa-Nang Curry. We loved it! Great value. Everything came out on time and deliciously hand-prepared. We came hungry and left totally satisfied - not stuffed. We're totally looking forward to going back!
author: Robin d.

description: Absolutely the best Thai food I have ever eaten.  It's a small place but you can order to go.  I love the red chicken curry as well as the salmon skewers.  Parking could be difficult depending on the time of day since it is all street parking only.  It's worth the walk!
author: Ben E.

description:
we came for a quiet sunday afternoon lunch. server was super friendly. 

ordered:

beef salad: a little on the small side but SO DELISH FRESH FLAVORFUL. prob best beef salad I have ever tasted! 

pumpkin curry: very authentic tasting and not sure how to describe it but it was a nice darker curry (unlike the usual sweeter varieties you get at other thai places) but it was SPICY

Pad thai: thanks to yelp for the recommendation, but again on the SPICY side but loved the fresh peanuts and other ingredients. came with grilled pineapple on the side which was DELISH and a nice fancy touch.

brown rice: SO flavorful and not the standard brown rice but the authentic off the husk kind, sorry not sure how to describe it.

I think next time we go I have to remember to ask them to make the dishes not as spicy (since I don't personally like spicy thai food). but otherwise it was a great experience. quiet, clean, the perfect lunch. our party had a great time.
author: Win H.

description: The Cottage is an excellent choice for Thai food. Great variety on the menu. Chef Sabrina chats with patrons and staff members offer sage advice on food and drinks.
author: Larry S.

description:
The night we moved into our house in Outer Sunset we looked for a restaurant open late after we got our boxes in the house.  It was 9:50 when we found Thai Cottage open, and went in.  After explaining our situation, Sabrina, the proprietor, said that even though she had closed the kitchen, she would never send away hungry people, and prepared us wonderful noodles and soup to take home.  We have gone to eat there many times since and have eaten many of the menu items.  Every one has been a  winner (Tiger Cried salad!).  The restaurant is small, well-decorated with a cheerful electric fire on cold nights.  Sabrina recently hired a very nice server who knows the menu,  We had two apps, 1 soup, 2 beers,  4 mains and 2 desserts for 4 people most recently, and the most expensive item was $8.00.  The total bill was $60.00.  And the food was, as usual, exquisite.  The dessert we wanted was not on the menu, it was something we asked for, and it came beautifully garnished with fresh herbs and a strawberry coulis.

Thai Cottage is aptly named, because it's a cozy place with a warm and accommodating proprietor who works hard to make one feel welcome and well-fed. We urge you to give it a try.
author: Diane S.

description: This place has really great food.  If you want tasty, fresh, authentic Thai food, check it out.  The staff is real friendly and the prices are reasonable.  The hot tea is AWESOME! It's a small place though, so be prepared.
author: Mike M.

description: Very impressed with this little gem. Yes, it is a small restaurant but that is what makes it unique. The atmosphere is nice, a definite first date scene. The service, very well set up, the server is there to see if you are comfortable and all is well, but not overbearing. The wine selection, Sabrina has impressed me with every bottle she has chosen for my party each time, with full satisfaction of her choice. The food OMG - I've been to the Thai Cottage several times and each time, i have been well satisfied with each dish I taste. The Pumpkin Curry is by far my favorite. But then again there are a lot of dishes I'm still looking forward to try. Going back this week - can't wait. Major thumbs up for Sabrina and her husband - you rock,
author: Yolanda G.

description: as i searched for a new restaurant in our neighborhood, i discovered and recommend thai cottage restaurant.  we were pleased with our delicious dishes and dessert - just the right balance of spices and sweetness... not salty.  also, chef and owner, sabrina, is down to earth and a delight to get to know; her style is about quality not quantity - you see it in her small restaurant.  thai cottage restaurant is as good if not better than other thai restaurants in the city.
author: Artemis R.

description:
wonderful fried veggie spring rolls! and really good noodle and seafood dishes.  and they have that good tea perfect to sip on while waiting for your food and eating your food!  they love their chili sauce so make sure you specify if you don't want it too spicy, fellow sensitive tonguers!  it's a cute little place to dine right off of the N-Judah, and the service is friendly.  so if you're out in the avenues i definitely suggest stopping in for some good thai and singha!  

oh yeah, i think i grabbed too many cards on the way out.  i usually take a card to ensure accurate yelping and even the cards are pretty!  they're shiny and even smell like flowers!! i actually feel bad that i took 5 of them because i got a green one a yellow one and a pink one!  they can't be cheap to print!
author: Monk R.

description: Excellent lil place with excellent food. Don't be fooled by the facade. This place is a little gem
author: The Y s.

description: There for the first time last night and can not believe we haven't been there before. We live in the area and we are so delighted that we found this amazing thai food restaurant. Service was lovely, not too quick, just right time to cook food from scratch. Very clean, lovely atmosphere and wonderful service. I think it would suit groups of 5 and under and a lovely place to take your date. The brown rice was so tasty and as someone else mentioned.. their dishes are a little more complex and flavorful and their prices and great.
author: Noreen M.

description: Thai Cottage is amazing, that is all there is to say.  GREAT food, cheap prices and amazing service.  Get the Pumpkin Curry, you will not be sorry!!
author: L M.

description: Pretty good little place to good for some tasty Thai. The server is very polite and the food is good. I'm a fan of the pounded chicken on a stick with the peanut dipping sauce. Hell, anything on a stick is always better.
author: Dustin H.

description: This is the best thai food I've ever had. The yellow pumpkin curry with beef, pad eggplant, and pad thai are amazing! The wait staff is super friendly and the ambiance is perfect. The take-out is also really good - they wrap up the food really good so it doesn't spill or anything. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Brian B.

description: nice place. good food. great service (amy).
author: jesus g.

description: The satay and cucumber salad was delicious!  I also enjoyed the warmth and friendliness...keep up the good work!
author: Liz C.

description: Congrats Thai Cottage, you have officially made the worst meal I have had in San Francisco (crispy ffried tofu with basil).  Absolutley awful little nuggets of hardness.  I am not sure if the other reviewer had the same dish as me but this was really bad.  I had ate here 1-2 before and thought it was OK.  This was not however.  The egg rolls sucked too.  Maybe an off night?  I won't be back to find out.
author: Tony B.

description: Found this place as a shot in the dark.  Gracious service, great soup.  Lets go again!
author: Jennifer H.

description: This is an unassuming neighborhood joint, quaintly decorated, with just a few tables.  The menu is surprisingly extensive.  I knew these people took their cuisine seriously though when I first tried the salmon and was pleasantly surprised by a nice cut of fish, perfectly prepared, crispy on the edges.  Many of the selections are quite authentic and probaby appeal most to the seasoned Thai palat.  I'm so glad that Thai Cottage has persevered for so long out here on the coast, especially considering it has often been empty or nearly so when I have eaten there.
author: Laura C.

description: Thai Cottage seems to be a small and simple family restaurant, the quality of the cuisine is in no way outstanding but still decent and reasonably good which by itself put it above a lot of other places in Sunset.
author: Cedrick C.

description:
The worst thing about this place is the promptness of the service, or lack thereof.  My daughters and I had dinner there on a Friday night; it  wasn't terribly busy, and there's only one server for the tiny restaurant.  We were seated right away, but then had to wait awhile before we got menus.  Then waited some more before our order was taken.  My daughters' Thai iced tea came out pretty quickly, but then I had to send it back because my younger daughter found some crud dangling at the end of the straw.  Food finally came out, but then my water didn't come out until after I had already started eating.  (By contrast, I saw another couple who received their water right away, so was it me?)  Then we had to wait some more just to get our food boxed up and for our check.   I am not an unreasonable person: I know that there was only one server, but not every table was full, and the restaurant was tiny.  The amount of time that we had to wait and wait was unexcusable in my book. Even my older daughter remarked as soon as we left, "That place didn't have very good service."  We didn't even stay for dessert even though we love Thai desserts because we were tired of waiting!

The food is OK, have definitely had better at Marnee or even King of Thai, but it's fine at Thai Cottage, on the whole.  My daughters had the Gai Pad Gra Prow (Chicken with Basil), and I had a dish of prawns and scallops with a touch of curry sauce.  The sauce was tasty, but my scallops were overcooked and rubbery.
author: Sun L.
